title: Joshua Tree National Park: Education
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education             Education        Students learn about creosote bush while experiencing Joshua Tree National Park on a field trip. NPS/Jesmira Bonoan       A Learning Adventure Awaits   Joshua Tree National Park holds wonders for your students, whether they visit the park on a field trip or have a park ranger come to their classroom.   For the 2016-2017 school year, ranger-led programs will be offered starting on October 3, 2016. We are accepting reservation requests now. Find out more and download reservation request forms using the links below.      Field Trips A school trip to Joshua Tree creates opportunities for memorable, meaningful learning. Your visit can be ranger-led or self-guided. Find out more about program options, request that a ranger lead your field trip, apply for an academic fee waiver, or request transportation funding.      Guest Speakers Students love having a real park ranger visit their class. Learn about our program offerings and find out how to request a classroom visit.      Curriculum Materials Find lesson plans about Joshua Tree National Park's geology, ecology, and human history.      Professional Development Find resources for environmental education instruction.     Contact us:Email Us Voice: 760-367-3012 Fax: 760-367-6392  Mail: Education Office Joshua Tree National Park 9800 Black Rock Canyon Road Yucca Valley, CA 92284
